title: Permaban chats should be a thing
body:
Like this is getting really dumb, I just got mine 3rd 14-day ban in 2019, I mean if it is meant for reforming people, obviously it's not doing it's job at all.
I would rather be permabanned from using chat and /all chat than this, so only communication that is available is with pings but I guess Riot never learns.
I'l probably chill for a month after this ban, up my honor level and then start being ultra toxic again. Really bad system.

replies.body: I mean, you can disable /all yourself. Then just, you know, not type at your team/mute them.

From [Riot Tantram:](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/wsObUaFj-if-tyler1?comment=00010001000000000000) 

> It really breaks down into two categories.
> 
> 1.) Helping players reform
> 2.) Shielding others from the behavior, at a cost.
> 
> We used to issue chat restrictions that essentially scaled indefinitely. 
> 
> We were able to determine that after a certain point the penalty no longer helped with reform. The 10-game and 25-game counts for chat restrictions are based on data that they were both light enough, and felt strict enough to encourage people to understand their behavior is unacceptable in game and change it.
> 
> We also saw that the players in this 'large restriction' category defaulted to gameplay altering means of harassing their team. It caused an increase in feeding and trolling.
> 
> The sample size of this population and time frame is huge. Essentially the time spanning from the introduction of chat restrictions to the introduction of IFS.
> 
> So my question for you is, would you rather have more feeders and less negative chat?

This was just with infinite chat restrictions, so imagine how much worse it would be with actual perma-mutes.

Bottom line: If someone isn't gonna behave properly despite being given multiple chances to do so then why shouldn't they be removed from the game?

why not give them a choice to chat off then? if a toxic person knows they are gonna be toxic. make it so you can turn chat off. AND GUESS WHAT. they will still throw their money away on your trash game and they cant get perma banned. wala.

> why not give them a choice to chat off then? if a toxic person knows they are gonna be toxic. make it so you can turn chat off.

If you give a toxic person the option to either be toxic or be silent, they're largely just going to be toxic. Any system that hinges its effectiveness on a player being conscious of their own toxicity is pretty likely to fail.

> AND GUESS WHAT. they will still throw their money away on your trash game and they cant get perma banned.

And what if Riot _wants_ toxic players to be permabanned, and what if they don't care about the toxic players' money? Since, as it stands, that is Riot's official stance. They don't want unrepentant toxic players playing their game, and they really don't need or want those toxic players' money.

> wala.

Small nitpick; it's "voilÃ ", not "wala".
not want toxic players money? is that why they allow people to make infinite accounts..?

> is that why they allow people to make infinite accounts..?

Well, how are they going to _stop_ them from making accounts? Since their game is Free-to-Play, there's no bar to re-entry, and they can't (to my knowledge) feasibly ID ban every single person they want to leave the game.

So what are they supposed to do? They can't particularly _keep_ those players out, due to the nature of League being a Free-to-Play game, but that doesn't mean that they want those toxic players to come back and buy more stuff.
Riot tried accumulating chat restrictions, but those players ended up being toxic in other ways. Why is your "ultra toxicity" the system's fault, anyway?

So it's the system's fault you have no self control makes sense

because permanent chat restriction won't work
that has been explained many times

And the punishments are supposed to hurt. And if you've spent money and time on your account, it will hurt

3 14 day bans? It's time to stop being toxic
You got your 3rd 14 day ban? May I ask how exactly does the situation look like? Like 3x 14 day ban on 3 different accounts or 3 on this account - which time period was between them?

> [{quoted}](name=FFrazien,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=jMprxAEz,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2019-04-13T23:39:56.283+0000)
>
> 3 on this account, 1st one was on like december 27th and I remember I got one back in may 2018, but I play this game a lot and I always level up my honor and so you reset the punishment levels

Like i said, the system is terrible, it is not meant for reforming people and as you see it is not meant for keeping toxic people out of the game, so for what the hell is it made for? You wanna know for what? MONEY. If you invested a lot in your account and let's say it gets permabanned and if you're an addict you will probably make a new account and spent more money on it.

the system cant reform people who have no interest in reforming

there will always be jerks on the internet, sry to say

In my eyes reforming people is kinda hard as it needs the insight and willingness of the player him/herself. 

I mean when you are able to survive 3x 14 day bans, which is quite unusual but I give you the benefit of the doubt, it means that you showed constant positive or neutral behaviour which lead to setting back one step of the punishment system. So are people sometimes toxic? Yes. But I don't think that they are completely toxic as they should have earned their perma ban already otherwise.
